{"step_by_step_thinking": "No relevant information about wrist joint formation is found in the provided documents. Therefore, I will analyze each option to determine which one is not related to wrist joint formation.

Option A: Scaphoid - This bone is part of the carpal bones that form the wrist joint.
Option B: Ulna - This long bone is located in the forearm and does not participate directly in the formation of the wrist joint.
Option C: Radius - Like the ulna, this long bone is located in the forearm and is not involved in the formation of the wrist joint.
Option D: Triquetral - This carpal bone also forms part of the wrist joint.
